Line 17: Line 17:
== Biography ==
== Biography ==
  +
Colton Harris-Moore grew up in his mother's house in the Stanwood-Camano School District.<ref name=brooks-feb07 /> Neighbors said they made several calls to Child Protective Services, believing Colton was neglected or abused.<ref name=brooks-feb07 /> Colton was in and out of trouble since pre-adolescence, and police found a neighbor's camcorder in his home in 2003. Never before sentenced to more than a month,<ref name=brooks-feb07 /> Harris-Moore fled a 3-year sentence by walking out of a halfway house in April 2008.<ref name=stevick />
  +   +
Colton's mother, Pam Kohler, has said that her son's father left when he was about 2, his stepfather died when he was about 7, and from the time Colton was in the first grade, she knew there was something off about himâa "sort of a disconnection." He wouldn't listen to his teachers, started altercations at school, and sometimes deliberately broke things around the house, Kohler said.<ref name=katu />
He attended [[Stanwood High School]] up to the end of his sophomore year.
He attended [[Stanwood High School]] up to the end of his sophomore year.

==Film==
â
[[20th Century Fox]] has bought the film rights to the book ''Taking Flight: The Hunt for a Young Outlaw'' for Rough House Pictures to produce. [[David Gordon Green]] is tapped to direct the film.
+
[[20th Century Fox]] has bought the film rights to the book ''Taking Flight: The Hunt for a Young Outlaw'' for Rough House Pictures to produce. [[David Gordon Green]] is tapped to direct the film.<ref>{{citenews |date=13 Apr 2010 |title=20th Century Fox is Taking Flight |work=ComingSoon.net / http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=65129 |accessdate=April 13, 2010 }}</ref>
